ccx074@pglaf.org.  Many thanks to Norfolk and Norwich Millennium Library,
UK, for kindly supplying the images from which this transcription was
made.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.

line: THE CONVICT'S FAREWELL, &c.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Farewell ye partner of my woes, farewell!

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: The finest language could but faintly tell,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: What I now feel in writing this adieu,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: What you must suffer when I'm far from you.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: There was a time when happiness my lot,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I liv'd serenely in my little cot;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: No wicked thoughts did there disturb my rest,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: My children round me, by a father prest;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: No father now, methinks I hear them say,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: He's gone from us, he's hurried far away.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Nightly I've view'd them in my flurri'd dreams,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Seen their wet eyes and heard their dreadful screams;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Methought my wife came to my lonely cell,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: To say adieu, to bid a long farewell;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Soon I awoke and to increase my pains,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I felt my legs encompass'd round with chains;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Then, then I cried, oh drunkenness thou cause,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Of this distress, and made me break those laws

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: That wise men made for every man to keep,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: By them deluded, plung'd in crimes so deep.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: First step to ruin was a love of dice,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: With cards the great promoter of our vice;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I wish those men who do with such things play,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Would ever cast them from their hands away;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I wish all Magistrates would search around,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And punish Publicans where they are found:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: They caused me first my Master to neglect;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And after lost me honest men's respect;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: They also led me from a virtuous wife,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And mostly caused my lad disgrace and strife.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: View Public Houses, every wealthy Squire,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And force by ten, the spendthrift to retire;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: By such a plan, the labouring poor would rise,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Soon as the Sun adorns the heavenly skies:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I've stated what have brought me to this end,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And what has lost me every earthly friend;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Except a wife--oh God protect and bless,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Her and our offspring now in great distress.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Young men be cautious how ye spend your time,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: A bad acquaintance hurries on a crime;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Sometimes an artful female tries her power,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: To trap the giddy in a thoughtless hour;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: When she has work'd the captive to her will,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: She gladly sees your taking sorrow's pill;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Cause you to leave a virtuous homely wife,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And lead a sad disgraceful wicked life;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Allur'd by art she'll bring you to distress,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And like a Millwood to you falsely press:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Then be the first your actions to betray,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: A fiend like such, caus'd me to go astray

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: From them I love, from those my heart hold dear,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And shall till death their memories revere;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: When I am clos'd in transport on the sea,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Doubtless my love you'll sometimes sigh for me.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Bring up my little ones in such a way,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: As they will holy keep the sabbath-day;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Early in life do in their minds reveal,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: The dreadful crimes to swear, to lie, or steal.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Hannah my eldest daughter place her where,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: She's constant under virtue's eye and care;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Let her not learn the weaving trade, you'll find,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: That such a course may injure much her mind;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Females are ready to acquire that art,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Soon as they wish fair virtue to depart,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Unwilling oft in service for to be,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Where they can't dress and have their liberty;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: But if with parents they can work at home,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Nightly they hope with idle folks to roam:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: At my late sentence I can not complain,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Altho' the law my body do detain;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Justice tho' slow, has overtaken me,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Abroad for life, I shall be kept from thee;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: On a just God for ever I will trust,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I know his will is always right and just.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Tis now too late again to speak to you,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Which is the cause of writing this adieu.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: No partner now to sooth my aching heart,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Reflection galls me, at myself I start,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: With aching heart and in my lonely cell,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I bid my babes and you,--a long farewell.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Methinks I see the transport full in view,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And I with horror meet the harden'd crew;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Full well I know I ne'er shall see you more,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Nor plant a foot-step on my native shore;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: On foreign land I'm doom'd my days to toil,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And with vile wretches cultivate the soil.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Stripes I must bare perhaps when quite unwell,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And hear the convicts' melancholy yell;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: A pang I feel when e'er I close the night,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And wish a virtuous wife was in my sight:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: England adieu, may you in trade increase,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And free from inward tumults rest in peace.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Our Chaplain well I know, will soon impart,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: His friendly aid to cheer the drooping heart;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I hope my children he will learn to read,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And teach them early to peruse the creed:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: The bell is rung, the waggon is in view,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Wife and dear children now, adieu! adieu!

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: At thoughts of leaving this my native shore,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Unmans me quite and I can say no more;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I will thro' life, a better course pursue,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Tho' far away shall leave my heart with you.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: ADVICE, &c.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Vile men, abstain from every artful plan,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: When found out disgrace the name of man;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Let those who steal, repent and sin no more,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Ere Law decrees, it's vengeance on them pour:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: From trifling things, we greater ills pursue,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Till the Law's fangs are brought within our view;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Stop, stop bad courses, ere it be too late,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And justice dooms you to a culprit's fate.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Riots avoid, tho' mischief none you do,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Your being at them, brings a stain on you;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Those who look on, will afterwards repent,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And share alike in point of punishment:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: The Law expressly properly declare,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: He adds to tumult, that is present there;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Take my advice, let reason bear her sway,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: From scenes of discord, always keep away;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: You'd think it hard, a worthless savage crew,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Should gain by plunder, all your goods from you:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: The worst of men are foremost on a plan,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: To gain by rapine, every way they can;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Do you suppose, that wasting other's store,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Can ease the hardships of the labouring poor;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: No such a course, our present ills increase,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And robs the Nation of its inward peace.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: From late example, all are taught to know,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Dreadful his fate, that strikes confusion's blow;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Then let us quiet at our Cots remain,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And better times will cheer us once again.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: All means are trying, comforts to restore,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: To ease the hardships of the labouring poor;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Think what distress awaits dishonest ways,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Immur'd in prison many wretched days;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Not only days, perhaps they shed their tears,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: In Foreign Lands, for many dismal years;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Not only years, perhaps are doom'd for life,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Abroad to roam, from children, home, and wife;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Should it your lot in prison for to be,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Implore with fervent prayer the Deity;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Who will in time if you sincerely pray,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Lessen your troubles each succeeding day:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: It's thro' our Saviour's aid that we should crave,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: A gracious pardon ere we meet the grave;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: His intercession with the King of Kings,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Alone can save you, from eternal stings.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: When at the court, for trial you appear,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Speak nought but truth, you better for it fare;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: For should you dare to introduce a lie,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Justice's sharp eye each falsehood will descry:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: I've known a perjur'd witness brought to swear,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: The guilty felon, of his crime is clear;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Dismay'd, confus'd, he feels alas! too late,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Such impious conduct greatly aggravate;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Besides he answers at the awful day,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: For causing others from the truth to stray.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Whatever happens in this vale of tears,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Our Maker knows, give him your fervent prayers:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Let your demeanor if in prison be,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Such as the jailor can contrition see;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: For his report may mitigate your doom,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And sometimes save you from a prison's gloom.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Religious Books if you can read attend,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: They are in solitude the pris'ner's friend;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: When at the Chapel, do not cast away,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: By inattention what the Chaplain say:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: It's pure Religion cheers each good man's heart,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And will in time its blessings soon impart;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Such as perhaps you never knew before,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And doubtless will your peace of mind restore.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: The Bible read, when in your dismal cell,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Read it attentive, ere you bid farewell;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: To him who may companion with you be;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Your soul that night may be required of thee.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: A scene I witnessed, and not long time since,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Would stop the errors of an hardened prince;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Three men were sentenc'd by the Law to die,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: To hear them mourn, to see the drooping eye;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Would cause sensations of a painful kind,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: While anxious cares corode the tortur'd mind.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: A pious Chaplain strove, to bring in view,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: The proffer'd pardon if repentants true.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: He said that God was merciful and just,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: To implore forgiveness, on his word to trust;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: There is a record where the scripture say,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Those that repent he will not cast away;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: A sigh or tear cannot that boon impart,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: It must be fervent from the head and heart:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Thro' Jesus' aid vile sinners doth he save,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: If true repentants, ere they meet the grave.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Each wish'd they could recal, the time that's past,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: And they would live as if each day the last:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Just before death, they pray'd me to implore,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: An erring mortal to transgress no more;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Hope their lov'd Chaplain might, for ever be

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: When call'd on high, blessed to eternity;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: They knew his worth his heart is of a kind,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: That plants soft pity to a feeling mind:

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Deeker, as Chaplain, few can e'er excel,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Belov'd by all who bids the jail farewell.

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: When first I saw these wretched men in jail,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Before their trial, did their fate bewail;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Soon as the sentence met each anxious ear,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Resign'd, and true repentants did appear;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: One and all cried out, oh that God how just!

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: To stop our sad career, on thee we'll trust;

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: One cause alone have made this sore distress,

Poem Title: PRINTED BY R. WALKER, NEAR THE DUKE'S PALACE.
line: Neglecting Lord's day and our drunkenness.
